Posts.EditableText:
It's been awhile since I have been to this site.  I started creating my first graphic adventures on the old ZX Spectrum 48k way back when I was 13.  I loved it, and loved the hobby.

However, I don't know how we can survive with the existential threat of AI.

I mean, I just had a game of D&D with it, and if this was a text based game, then it had a valid response to everything I typed.

I think we need to come up with some ways to preserve our creative hobby and stop this threat.  Any ideas folks?

Posts.EditableText:
The dark magic of the ancients. Call upon the Gods of the dawn of time. We have sovereignty with them! 
AI are mere mimics of life, while we are life and breath, and so, with living spirit, we will vanquish, and the inconveniently uncanny, into the unquenchable depths, we will overthrow.
